definitions.definition: To enlarge an object by pushing air (or a gas) into it; to raise or expand abnormally
definitions.example: You inflate a balloon by blowing air into it.

definitions.definition: To enlarge by filling with air (or a gas).
definitions.example: The balloon will inflate if you blow into it.
to inflate somebody with pride or vanity

definitions.definition: To decompress (data) that was previously deflated.

definitions.example: The inflated balloons danced in the breeze.

definitions.definition: Expanded; in a state of inflation, of abnormally increased size, amount, etc.
: In a state of higher cost.
definitions.example: His inflated prices made the vendor unpopular.

definitions.definition: Pompous; arrogant (of a person or ego)
Containing excessive, meaningless words, particularly for show
definitions.example: The inflated speech did not impress the audience.
